heart_rate_sentinel_server module¶

heart_rate_sentinel_server.get_heart_rate_average(patient_id)¶

should return the patients’s average heart rate over all measurements have stored for this user.

Parameters:patient_id – request patient_id
Returns:json data contains “heart_rate_average”
heart_rate_sentinel_server.get_heart_rates(patient_id)¶

should return all the previous heart rate measurements for that patient.

Parameters:patient_id –
Returns:json data contains “heart_rates”
heart_rate_sentinel_server.get_status(patient_id)¶

should return whether this patient is currently tachycardic based on the previously available heart rate, and should also return the timestamp of the most recent heart rate.

Parameters:patient_id – request patient id
Returns:json data contains: “status” and “timestamp”
heart_rate_sentinel_server.post_heart_rate()¶

which should store this heart rate measurement for the user with that id, as well as a time stamp.

Expected request data: POST /api/heart_rate with {

“patient_id”: “1”, # usually this would be the patient MRN “heart_rate”: 100

}

Returns:400 if data entry is not valid, 200 if data is successfully saved
heart_rate_sentinel_server.post_heart_rate_interval_average()¶

should return the patients’s average heart rate since the post time

expected request data: POST /api/heart_rate/interval_average with {

“patient_id”: “1”, “heart_rate_average_since”: “2018-03-09 11:00:36.372339” // date string

}

Returns:400 if data entry is not valid, json data contains “heart_rate_interval_average” if data entry is valid
heart_rate_sentinel_server.post_new_patient()¶

This will be called when the heart rate monitor is checked out to be attached to a particular patient, the system emits this event to register the patient with your heart rate server. This will allow you to initialize a patient, and accept future heart rate measurements for this patient.

expected request data: POST /api/new_patient with {

“patient_id”: “1”, # usually this would be the patient MRN “attending_email”: “suyash.kumar@duke.edu”, “user_age”: 50, # in years

}

Returns:400 if data entry is not valid, 200 if data is successfully saved
